Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by: Rev. Chole Breyer, Associate Priest, St. Phillips Church, 204 West 134th Street, New York, N.Y. 10030.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Dickens.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by:Rev. Chloe Breyer, Associate Priest, St. Phillip's Church, 204 West 134th Street, New York, N.Y. 10030.

Council Member Dickens moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of December 16, 2015 and the Charter Meeting of January 6, 2016 be adopted as printed by Council Member Rosenthal.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Rosenthal moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of December 16, 2015 and the Charter Meeting of Janaury 6, 2016 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Messages & Papers from the Mayor

Communication from the Mayor - Submitting the name of Shin-pei Tsay to the Council for its advice and consent regarding her appointment as a member of the New York City Art Commission, known as the Public Design Commission, pursuant to Sections 31 and 851 of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections
Items.MatterName: Shin-pei Tsay, New York City Art Commission

Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council
Items.MatterName: Submitting the report, and supporting the recommendations, of the Advisory Commission for the Review of Compensation Levels of Elected Officials.

Items.Title: Land Use Call-Ups

By Council Member Chin:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Review Procedure Application No. C 150384 ZSM shall be subject to Council Review.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, 321 Canal Street, Manhattan (C150384ZSM)

Items.Title:
By Council Member Chin:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Review Procedure Application No. C 150385 ZSM shall be subject to Council Review.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, 323 Canal Street, Manhattan (C150385ZSM)

Items.Title:
By the Chair of the Land Use Committee Council Member Greenfield: 
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council Rules and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Review Procedure application nos. C 150417 ZSM and C 150418 ZSM shall be subject to Council review. These items are related to Application no. N 150416 ZRM which is subject to Council review pursuant to Section 197-d(b)(1) of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, 150 Wooster Street, Manhattan (N150416ZRM, C150417ZSM and C150418ZSM)

Items.Title: Reports of Standing Committees
Resolution adopting the rule amendment of the Procurement Policy Board to raise the micropurchase limit for the procurement and award of construction contracts to $35,000.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Contracts
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) declared the Resolution to be adopted.


Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Adopting the rule amendment of the Procurement Policy Board to raise the micropurchase limit for the procurement and award of construction contracts to $35,000.

Items.MinutesNote: The Public Advocate (Ms. James)

The presence of a quorum was announced by The Public Advocate (Ms. James).

There is one vacancy in the Council pending the swearing-in of the certified winner of the February 23, 2016 Special Election in the 17th District (The Bronx).
The Public Advocate (Ms James) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such motion which was decided in the affirmative by the following vote:
At this point, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) declared that the aforementioned items were adopted and referred to the Committee on Land Use and to the appropriate Land Use Subcommittee.

Items.Title: Application No. 20165089 TCM pursuant to Section 20-226 of the Administrative Code of the City of New York, concerning the petition of 643 Broadway Holdings LLC, for a revocable consent to establish, maintain and operate an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 643 Broadway, Borough of Manhattan, Community Board 2, Council District 1.
